newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gilts to test 114-17 resistance.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gilts to test 114-17 resistance.

text.p: September gilts will try and push up towards congestion at 114-16,17 on Monday before drifting back, technical analysts said.
But a break of that area would open up the potential for a move to 114-31, the high on May 9, they added.
"The fact the market made it higher on Friday is encouraging short term and suggests we're going to have a look at 114-16,17," said Marc Ostwald, technical analyst at London Bond Broking here.
"We'll probably drift back from there, but if we do go through it, we could go to the 114-31 high."

Ostwald said while underlying technicals for gilts were fairly encouraging, and the contract may benefit from safe-haven status if single currency worries resurface, some concerns such as the upcoming British budget would keep a lid on gains.
He put initial support at 113-25,27. Charts show 113-25 was the low on Friday, and the high on June 5.
"If we get down to 113-25, we could push down a bit further, but not enormously," said Otwald. He put further support at 113-15, the lows last Thursday and Monday.
"If we were to drift below that, we would establish a base around 113-00," said Ostwald.

Juliette Clark at the Royal Bank of Scotland said the near-doji formation on candle charts on Friday suggested gilts were in for a period of turbulent trading. A doji is where the opening and closing are at the same level.
"The long term view is still firmly bullish though, and the break above the interim high at 114-08 is constructive," she said in a note for clients.
She said momentum indicators suggested plenty of scope for gains over the next week, with the positive impetus growing once 114-10 was hurdled.
By 0722 GMT September short sterling was unchanged at 93.15.
